title: Documentation
description: Comprehensive project documentation. Includes: ARCHITECTURE.md with Mermaid diagrams, PLAYBOOK.md with how-to guides, TROUBLESHOOTING.md, finalized README.md.

title: Client Adapter
description: Outbound HTTP client adapter with Anti-Corruption Layer patterns. Includes: instrumented HTTP client base with retry/circuit breaker/tracing/correlation ID propagation, ACL translation patterns.

title: Initialize Go module
description:
Create go.mod with module path github.com/jsamuelsen/go-service-template. Use Go 1.22+ for latest features. Include a comment noting this path is a template and should be replaced.

**Files**: go.mod
**Acceptance Criteria**:
- Module path is github.com/jsamuelsen/go-service-template
- Go version is 1.22 or higher
- Comment explains this is a template module path

title: Main Wiring
description: Application bootstrap and dependency injection. Includes: main.go with full dependency wiring, graceful shutdown, fail-fast config loading.

title: Create .gitignore
description:
Create comprehensive .gitignore covering: Go binaries, test coverage, IDE files (VS Code, GoLand, Vim), OS files (macOS, Linux, Windows), dependency directories, build artifacts, local config overrides.

**Files**: .gitignore
**Acceptance Criteria**:
- Covers Go build outputs (*.exe, *.test, *.out)
- Covers coverage files (coverage.out, coverage.html)
- Covers IDE directories (.idea/, .vscode/)
- Covers OS files (.DS_Store, Thumbs.db)
- Covers local overrides (*.local.yaml)

title: Foundation
description: Project scaffolding and build tooling. Establishes the foundation that all other work depends on. Includes: go.mod, directory structure, .gitignore, Taskfile.yml, .golangci.yml, .pre-commit-config.yaml, Dockerfile, README skeleton.

title: CI/CD Pipeline
description: GitHub Actions CI/CD workflows. Includes: CI workflow (lint, test, coverage, OpenAPI drift, govulncheck), release workflow (build, Docker, SBOM).

title: Testing Infrastructure
description: Testing infrastructure including unit tests, integration tests, benchmarks, and load tests. Includes: mockery config, GoDog runner, health feature file, step definitions, benchmark tests, k6 load tests.

title: Core Architecture
description: Domain and ports layer — the heart of the application. Pure business logic with no infrastructure dependencies. Includes: domain errors, service ports, feature flag port, health registry port, app service skeleton, transactional service pattern (Validate→Perform→Verify→Archive→Respond), structured concurrency with errgroup.

title: Go Service Template
description: Industry-leading Go backend service template implementing Clean/Hexagonal Architecture with enterprise-grade observability, security, and testing. This is the top-level epic. See plan at /home/jsamuelsen/.claude/plans/peppy-crunching-cake.md

title: Platform Layer
description: Cross-cutting infrastructure layer providing configuration, logging, and telemetry. Includes: koanf config loader, config validation, environment profiles, slog logger, context-aware logging, secret redaction, OpenTelemetry setup, Gin OTEL middleware.

title: Create directory structure
description:
Create all directories as defined in the Project Structure. Use .gitkeep files in empty directories to ensure they're tracked.

**Directories**: cmd/service/, internal/app/, internal/domain/, internal/ports/, internal/adapters/http/handlers/, internal/adapters/http/middleware/, internal/adapters/http/dto/, internal/adapters/clients/acl/, internal/platform/config/, internal/platform/logging/, internal/platform/telemetry/, api/, configs/, docs/, test/features/, test/integration/, test/load/k6/, test/benchmark/, .github/workflows/

**Acceptance Criteria**:
- All directories exist
- Empty directories have .gitkeep
- Structure matches architecture diagram exactly

title: HTTP Adapter
description: Inbound HTTP adapter using Gin. Handles HTTP concerns and delegates to application layer. Includes: Gin server, request ID middleware, correlation ID middleware, logging middleware, recovery middleware, timeout middleware, auth middleware factories, health handlers, error handling, pagination, request validation, router, OpenAPI spec.
